title: Function Concepts - Tabular and Analytical: Polynomial

content.question: Part A (i) The function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is defined by <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses g circle f close parentheses open parentheses x close parentheses equals g open parentheses f open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>∘</mo><mi>f</mi></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>. Find the value of <math alttext="h open parentheses 8 close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mn>8</mn></mfenced></math> as a decimal approximation, or indicate that it is not defined. Show the work that leads to your answer. (ii) Find the value of <math alttext="f inverse open parentheses 20 close parentheses"><msup><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mn>20</mn></mfenced></math>, or indicate that it is not defined.

frqParts.text: Part A (i) The function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is defined by <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses g circle f close parentheses open parentheses x close parentheses equals g open parentheses f open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>∘</mo><mi>f</mi></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>. Find the value of <math alttext="h open parentheses 8 close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mn>8</mn></mfenced></math> as a decimal approximation, or indicate that it is not defined. Show the work that leads to your answer. (ii) Find the value of <math alttext="f inverse open parentheses 20 close parentheses"><msup><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mn>20</mn></mfenced></math>, or indicate that it is not defined.

Part B (i) Find all values of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mi>x</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahqart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaaaa@36F0@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>, as decimal approximations, for which <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>45</mn></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahqart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaam4zaiaacI cacaWG4bGaaiykaiabg2da9iabgkHiTiaaisdacaaI1aaaaa@3CA5@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>, or indicate there are no such values. (ii) Determine the end behavior of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mi>g</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahqart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaam4zaaaa@36DF@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> as <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <semantics> <mi>x</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahqart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaaaa@36F0@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> increases without bound. Express your answer using the mathematical notation of a limit.

Part C (i) Based on the table, which of the following function types best models function <math> <semantics> <mi>f</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzaaaa@3883@</annotation> </semantics> </math>: linear, quadratic, exponential, or logarithmic? (ii) Give a reason for your answer in part C (i) based on the relationship between the change in the output values of <math> <semantics> <mi>f</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzaaaa@3883@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and the change in the input values of <math> <semantics> <mi>f</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamOzaaaa@3883@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Refer to the values in the table in your reasoning.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
